text.section:
This section applies to:
insurers and nonprofit health service plans that provide hospital, medical, or surgical benefits to individuals or groups on an expense-incurred basis under health insurance policies that are issued or delivered in the State; and
health maintenance organizations that provide hospital, medical, or surgical benefits to individuals or groups under contracts that are issued or delivered in the State.

section.section: An entity subject to this section that provides pregnancy-related benefits may not exclude benefits for all outpatient expenses arising from in vitro fertilization procedures performed on the policyholder or subscriber or dependent spouse of the policyholder or subscriber.

The benefits under this subsection shall be provided:
for insurers and nonprofit health service plans, to the same extent as the benefits provided for other pregnancy-related procedures; and
for health maintenance organizations, to the same extent as the benefits provided for other infertility services.

text.section: An entity subject to this section may limit coverage of the benefits required under this section to three in vitro fertilization attempts per live birth, not to exceed a maximum lifetime benefit of $100,000.

Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, if the coverage required under this section conflicts with the bona fide religious beliefs and practices of a religious organization, on request of the religious organization, an entity subject to this section shall exclude the coverage otherwise required under this section in a policy or contract with the religious organization.
